item.title: Shami ruled out of remaining two Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Mohammed Shami Ruled Out of Remaining Two Tests in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami has been ruled out of the fourth and fifth Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to swelling in his left knee, as per a BCCI press release.

  • Shami recently played for Bengal and had a busy schedule leading up to the Tests.
  • His knee swelling is attributed to increased workload from recent bowling activities.
  • The BCCI medical team recommends more time for recovery before he can return to play.
“The swelling is on the expected lines, owing to the increased bowling after a prolonged period.”

Shami has been recovering from a heel injury and will continue strength and conditioning work. His participation in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy will depend on his knee condition.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Y.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team has selected young Mumbai off-spinner Tanush Kotian to replace Ravichandran Ashwin, who announced his retirement following the third Test in Brisbane.

  • Tanush Kotian has played 33 First Class matches, taking 101 wickets.
  • Kotian has been included as a precautionary measure and will travel to Australia.
  • Originally, Axar Patel was considered for the replacement but opted out due to personal reasons.
  • Ashwin retired as India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket.
"I made myself a promise in 2012, we lost a tricky series against England. I was very early in my career and I was just telling myself we are not gonna lose another one. Ever. And that is what I promised myself," said Ashwin.

The addition of Kotian underscores the Indian team's strategy to maintain squad strength following Ashwin's retirement.

item.title: Watch: $300 At Stake As Sarfaraz Khan Captains Virat Kohli Ahead Of Boxing Day Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sarfaraz Khan Leads Team India in Fun Fielding Drill Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: NDTV

Ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia, Team India participated in an engaging fielding drill with a prize of 300 dollars at stake. The third Test ended in a draw, making the series tied at 1-1.

  • India's fielding coach T Dilip explained the target hitting system with three stumps.
  • Key objective was to energize the team before net practice.
  • Dhruv Jurel's group won the cash prize for the drill.
“Target hitting with points system. 3 groups led by young captains. Cash reward on the line. Fun, energy and intensity - #TeamIndia gears up for the Melbourne Test with a lively fielding drill with Fielding coach T Dilip,” BCCI announced.

The Boxing Day Test is set to commence on December 26 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

item.title: Indian chess GM Tania Sachdev slams authorities for lack of recognition in hard-hitting post: ‘Sadly, Delhi has yet to…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian Chess GM Tania Sachdev Calls for Greater Recognition from Delhi Government

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartfelt social media post, Women's Grandmaster Tania Sachdev expressed disappointment at the lack of recognition for chess players in Delhi, especially in light of recent successes in Indian chess.

  • Tania Sachdev criticizes the Delhi government's lack of support for chess achievers.
  • Highlights disparity in recognition compared to Gukesh's celebration in Tamil Nadu.
  • Emphasizes her achievements, including a historic bronze in the 2022 Chess Olympiad.
  • Calls on Delhi officials to value and support their chess athletes.
“Having played for India since 2008, it’s disheartening to see a lack of recognition from the Delhi government for achievements in chess.” - Tania Sachdev

Sachdev's impassioned plea seeks to inspire the government to celebrate and support chess achievements in Delhi, similar to other states in India.

item.title: Mumbai all-rounder Tanush Kotian to join India squad ahead of Melbourne Test - Sportstar
item.description:
Mumbai All-Rounder Tanush Kotian Joins India Squad Ahead of Melbourne Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Hindu

Tanush Kotian, an impressive off-spinning all-rounder from Mumbai, is set to join the Indian cricket squad for the upcoming Melbourne Test.

  • Kotian has been performing exceptionally in the Indian domestic circuit.
  • He was a member of the India A team that toured Australia recently.
  • His inclusion comes as part of the preparations for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
"Kotian has been one of the best off-spinning all-rounders in the Indian domestic circuit."

Kotian's addition to the squad reflects India's commitment to bolster their team with talented individuals ahead of a crucial series.

item.title: Vinod Kambli admitted to Thane hospital in critical condition - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Admitted to Thane Hospital in Critical Condition

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, has been hospitalized in Thane and is reported to be in critical condition. His health has raised concerns among fans and the cricket community.

  • Kambli has been experiencing severe health issues recently.
  • The exact cause of his critical condition has not been publicly disclosed.
  • Fans and former teammates have expressed their support and concern on social media.
"We are all praying for his speedy recovery." - A former teammate

This incident has highlighted the importance of health awareness among athletes.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar Slams India For Mistreating R Ashwin: 'Was Denied Even The Honor Of Vice-Captaincy' - News18
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Criticizes India for Ashwin's Treatment: Denied Vice-Captaincy

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: News18

Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has expressed his disappointment at the Indian team management for not allowing Ravichandran Ashwin the opportunity to serve as vice-captain, despite his leadership capabilities.

  • Gavaskar criticized the team management's decision to deny Ashwin the chance to lead in a token Test or bilateral series.
  • Ashwin retired with significant contributions, featuring in 106 Tests, and having taken 537 Test wickets.
  • Gavaskar pointed out that Ashwin's leadership potential was overlooked in favor of team balance.
  • Many believe that Ashwin's exclusion in favor of Washington Sundar for the first Test prompted his retirement decision.
“Ashwin would have made a fine captain for India, but he was denied even the honor of being the vice-captain.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The commentary by Gavaskar underlines a broader discussion on how veteran players are treated in the Indian team setup.

item.title: A look at Team India's probable Schedule of ICC Champions Trophy 2025 - India.com
item.description:
Team India's Schedule for ICC Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: India.com

The ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is approaching with a new hybrid model, ensuring India's matches are hosted in the UAE amidst security concerns over travel to Pakistan.

  • India will play group stage matches in Dubai against Bangladesh on February 20 and New Zealand on March 2.
  • Pakistan will begin the tournament with their first match against New Zealand in Karachi on February 19.
  • The semifinal matches are scheduled for March 4 and 5, with the final set for March 9.
  • Neutral venues will be used for matches between India and Pakistan to maintain impartiality.
  • Hosting all of India's matches in UAE aims to ensure a secure environment.
"Given the ongoing political tensions between India and Pakistan, any matches between these two nations will be played at impartial venues."

This tournament promises to be an exciting event, with critical matches taking place in Dubai offering neutral grounds for competing teams.

item.title: Real Madrid Decides Surprise Signing Of Former Player, Reports SPORT - Forbes
item.description:
Real Madrid Plans Surprise Return for Rafa Marin

Date: July 10, 2024 Source: SPORT

Real Madrid is reportedly looking to sign back Rafa Marin, who was sold to Napoli. This potential transfer is part of their ongoing strategy to strengthen the squad amidst injury challenges.

  • Rafa Marin was sold to Napoli for €12 million, with potential increases to €22 million based on conditions.
  • The deal included a buyback clause, a common practice for players from Madrid's academy.
  • Marin's return could happen as soon as January 2025 due to the club's defensive injuries.
  • The buyback clause is structured with escalating costs depending on the timing of the exercise.
“Madrid made sure to include a $27.1 million (€25 million) buy back clause which can be exercised in 2026.”

This strategic move indicates Madrid's confidence in Marin's potential and necessity in addressing current team deficiencies.

item.title: India vs Australia Boxing Day Test: Everything you should know - The Times of India
item.description:
India vs Australia Boxing Day Test: Everything You Should Know

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is currently level at 1-1, with the third Test starting on December 26th. This Boxing Day Test is crucial for both teams before the final Test in Sydney.

  • The Boxing Day Test is scheduled to be held at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
  • India won the last encounter at MCG in 2020.
  • Australia has historically performed well in Boxing Day Tests, having won five of the first seven matches against India.
  • The head-to-head record shows Australia with 46 wins, India with 33 wins, and 30 draws.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is six wickets away from his 200th Test wicket.
Sachin Tendulkar leads most runs scored overall with 3630, and Nathan Lyon holds the record for most wickets overall with 124.

This Boxing Day Test could shift team dynamics significantly, with implications for the World Test Championship.

item.title: 'Perfect' Man Utd Star Ruled Out Until March Due to Injury - GIVEMESPORT
item.description:
Perfect' Man Utd Star Ruled Out Until March Due to Injury

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Give Me Sport

Manchester United's Mason Mount has suffered a serious hamstring injury, which could keep him sidelined for up to ten weeks. This setback significantly impacts the team's performance as they look to improve their season.

  • Mount's injuries have plagued his time at Manchester United, having played only 14 Premier League matches last season.
  • The £55 million signing has become a favorite under new manager Ruben Amorim, despite limited appearances.
  • Mount's current injury is described as a hamstring issue caused by a hyperextended leg, with recovery expected to take around ten weeks.
"Mason Mount, Hamstring injury due to hyperextended leg, Tendon involved, horrible, around 10 weeks out depending on rehab and recovery!!"

Mount's frustrating season continues as he struggles to maintain a consistent presence on the pitch, missing vital matches for Manchester United.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's health deteriorates, admitted to Thane's Pragati hospital - India TV News
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted to Hospital

Date: Recent | Source: India TV News

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has been admitted to hospital after his health deteriorated. Doctors are monitoring his condition as necessary tests are being conducted.

  • Kambli was recently in the headlines after attending a memorial for Ramakant Achrekar, where he was seen in a wheelchair.
  • He was admitted to the hospital late on Saturday night and is currently stable but remains critical.
  • Members of the 1983 World Cup squad have offered financial support, which Kambli has accepted.
  • Kambli expressed his willingness to undergo rehab and thanked friends, including Ajay Jadeja and Abey Kuruvilla, for their support.
“I’m ready to go for rehab. I want to go there because I don’t fear anything. My family is with me,” said Kambli.

Kambli has played 17 Tests and 104 ODIs for India, scoring over 3000 runs with six centuries.

This situation has highlighted Kambli's ongoing health issues, drawing support from fans and former teammates alike.

item.title: Mohammad Shami and Sania Mirza spotted together in Dubai, find the truth behind VIRAL pic - India.com
item.description:
Mohammad Shami and Sania Mirza spotted together in Dubai, find the truth behind VIRAL pic

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: India.com

This article explores the truth behind viral images of Indian cricketer Mohammad Shami and tennis star Sania Mirza, who were allegedly spotted together in Dubai.

  • Viral pictures of Shami and Mirza circulating widely on social media.
  • Shami is currently in India preparing for the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024.
  • Sania Mirza recently divorced Shoaib Malik.
  • Sania lives with her son in Dubai and Hyderabad.
  • Shoaib Malik has remarried.
"Mohammad Shami hasn’t played international cricket since the ODI World Cup 2023 final due to injury."

The article clarifies misconceptions surrounding the leaked images and provides context about the personal lives of both Shami and Mirza.

item.title: 'Indian bowling looking a little weak': Cheteshwar Pujara raises concerns ahead of Boxing Day Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Indian bowling looking a little weak: Cheteshwar Pujara raises concerns ahead of Boxing Day Test

Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

As the Boxing Day Test against Australia approaches, veteran Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara has expressed his worries regarding the bowling line-up's ability to perform effectively in the match.

  • Pujara raises concerns about the Indian bowling's strength, doubting its ability to take 20 wickets.
  • He highlights Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj as standouts but notes others have underperformed.
  • Pujara questions the team combination and the effectiveness of the supporting bowlers like Nitish Kumar and Ravindra Jadeja.
  • He emphasizes the need to improve the bowling attack to win the match.
  • Pujara praises Australian bowler Mitchell Starc for his recent performances and warns Indian batters to be cautious against him.
“If you want to win a Test match, then you have to take 20 wickets, and the ability to take 20 wickets is not that good.” - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara's insights underline the potential challenges India may face in delivering a robust bowling performance in the upcoming match against a strong Australian team.

item.title: Marcus Rashford told he'll never be in Man Utd squad again after brutal Amorim decision and with squad 'fuming' - TEAMtalk
item.description:
Marcus Rashford told he'll never be in Man Utd squad again after brutal Amorim decision and with squad 'fuming'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: TeamTalk

Marcus Rashford faces a potential exit from Manchester United after being dropped for recent matches amid squad frustration over his public comments regarding a desire to leave the club.

  • Rashford has not played since being left out of the derby match against Manchester City.
  • His public statement expressing a wish for a new challenge has reportedly angered his teammates.
  • Gary Neville has reversed his previous support for Rashford's position in the squad.
  • The situation has escalated, with reports indicating the club’s intent to transfer him in January.
“For me, personally, I think I’m ready for a new challenge and the next steps.” – Marcus Rashford

The growing tensions suggest that Rashford’s future at Manchester United may be uncertain as he navigates this critical juncture in his career.

item.title: PV Sindhu marries Venkata Datta, look at first pic - The Times of India
item.description:
PV Sindhu Marries Venkata Datta, Look at First Pic

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

PV Sindhu, the renowned badminton player, has tied the knot with Venkata Datta. The couple's wedding took place in a private ceremony, and fans are eager to see the first pictures of the event.

  • The wedding was attended by family and close friends.
  • Sindhu shared a heartfelt message on her social media.
  • Fans have expressed their excitement and congratulations online.
"We are so happy to start this new chapter together." - PV Sindhu

This joyous occasion marks a significant personal milestone for Sindhu as she embarks on a new journey with Venkata Datta.

item.title: Star batter misses optional Aussie session; MCG curator rejects anti-India ‘conspiracy’ — Test Daily - Fox Sports
item.description:
Travis Head Avoids Optional Training Ahead of Boxing Day Test as MCG Curator Addresses Pitch Controversy

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Fox Sports

Australian cricket star Travis Head opted out of a non-compulsory training session as the country prepares for a crucial Test in the Border Gavaskar Trophy against India. Meanwhile, the MCG curator addressed claims of an anti-India bias regarding practice pitches.

  • Travis Head did not train but is confident about his performance after strong previous matches, scoring 409 runs with an average of 81.2 in the series.
  • Senior players engaged in lengthy training, while new potential entrants Konstas and Carey benefitted from the session.
  • The MCG curator clarified that Australia prepared pitches standard procedure, and India chose to train on slower pitches.
  • Temperature on the day of the match is expected to reach 40C, prompting additional medical personnel to be onsite.
“For us, three days out, we prepare Test match pitches for here. If teams come and train before that, they get what pitches we have had.” - Matt Page, MCG Curator

This training session sparks intrigue as Australia and India gear up for a vital Test match. The curator's remarks aim to placate potential tensions as international teams prepare for a high-stakes encounter.

item.title: Sania Mirza And Mohammad Shami Spotted Together In Dubai? AI Generated Photo Goes Viral - Oneindia
item.description:
Sania Mirza And Mohammad Shami Spotted Together In Dubai? Photo Goes Viral

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Oneindia

The personal lives of celebrities constantly attract attention, and the recent focus has been on Indian tennis star Sania Mirza and cricketer Mohammad Shami, leading to speculation about their relationship.

  • Rumors suggest Sania Mirza may be getting remarried, this time to cricketer Mohammad Shami.
  • These rumors gained traction after a photo of them together went viral on social media, although many questioned its authenticity.
  • Mirza is currently busy with commitments at the World Tennis League, while Shami is back in domestic cricket after an injury.
  • A fact check indicates that the viral photo is AI-generated, dispelling claims of them spending time together in Dubai.
"The claim is false; the video is AI-generated."

The ongoing gossip highlights the public's interest in their lives, but both are focusing on their careers despite the speculation.

item.title: Chess star Tania Sachdev slams Delhi government for failing to recognise her achievements: 'Disheartening' - Firstpost
item.description:
Tania Sachdev Criticizes Delhi Government for Lack of Support

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Firstpost

Indian chess star Tania Sachdev has expressed disappointment over the Delhi government’s lack of recognition for her achievements, stating that such acknowledgment is crucial for inspiring youth and fostering talent development.

  • Tania Sachdev is the eighth woman chess grandmaster from India.
  • She criticized the Delhi government for not recognizing her and other athletes' achievements in chess.
  • She urged for more support from Delhi's Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party leaders.
  • She highlighted her achievements, including a historic gold medal at the Chess Olympiad in 2024.
  • Sachdev contrasted the lack of recognition with Tamil Nadu's celebration of chess champion D Gukesh.
“Having played for India since 2008 it’s disheartening to see a lack of recognition from the Delhi government for achievements in chess. States that support and celebrate their champions inspire excellence and motivate talent.” — Tania Sachdev

Sachdev's comments reflect a broader issue regarding the recognition and support given to athletes by their respective state governments, potentially impacting the motivation and development of future talent.

item.title: Virat, Rohit, Shastri, Dravid, Gambhir come under fire for mistreating Ravichandran Ashwin - Crictoday
item.description:
Controversy Grows Over Ashwin's Treatment by Indian Cricket Team Management

Date: 2024-12-04
Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin, a veteran cricketer, faced significant scrutiny for being benched during crucial overseas Test matches due to team management decisions. His father described the situation as humiliating following Ashwin's retirement announcement from international cricket.

  • Ashwin was often excluded from the Playing XI in SENA countries, playing only 26 matches in 14 years.
  • Sunil Gavaskar condemned the management's choices, suggesting that favoritism was evident in their decisions regarding batting and bowling selections.
  • Gavaskar highlighted the imbalance in treatment between Ashwin and underperforming batters in international matches.
  • Ashwin achieved 765 wickets across formats, including 537 in Test cricket, and won the Player of the Series award 11 times.
“If the excuse of the pitch and conditions was given for dropping him, why the same didn’t apply for the batters, who were below-par in the SENA countries?” - Sunil Gavaskar

The controversy not only questions the team management's strategy but also casts a shadow on how legendary players like Ashwin are valued in the current setup.

item.title: Meet Nat Yoannidis, Australian reporter who went viral after aggressive argument with Virat Kohli in Melbourne - India.com
item.description:
Nat Yoannidis: The Australian Reporter Who Went Viral After an Argument with Virat Kohli

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: India.com

Nat Yoannidis, an Australian reporter, has recently garnered attention after a heated argument with Indian cricketer Virat Kohli at Melbourne airport, stirring significant debates on social media.

  • Nat was filming Kohli at Melbourne airport when the incident occurred.
  • Kohli requested Yoannidis to delete footage of his family, leading to a public outcry.
  • The clash highlighted cultural differences in media practices between Australia and India.
  • Yoannidis is recognized for her work in sports journalism and has covered multiple major sporting events.
  • Social media reactions were polarized, with discussions around family privacy and media responsibility.
"While some supported Kohli's plea for privacy, others viewed the interaction as an example of cultural differences in media practices."

This incident not only highlights the challenges reporters face but also opens up dialogue on the expectations of privacy for celebrities in the public eye.

item.title: PV Sindhu Marries Venkatta Datta Sai In Udaipur. First Pic Out - NDTV Sports
item.description:
PV Sindhu Marries Venkatta Datta Sai In Udaipur. First Pic Out

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

PV Sindhu, the ace Indian shuttler, married Venkata Datta Sai on Sunday in Udaipur, surrounded by family and close friends. The wedding was attended by notable guests, including Jodhpur's Culture and Tourism Minister, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, who shared the first photo of the couple.

  • The couple engaged on Saturday before their wedding.
  • They will be hosting a reception in Hyderabad on December 24.
  • A series of pre-wedding events included Sangeet, Haldi, Pellikuthuru, and Mehendi.
  • Sindhu's father noted that the wedding plans progressed quickly within a month.
  • Sindhu recently ended a two-year title drought in badminton, winning the Syed Modi India International tournament.
Pleased to have attended the wedding ceremony of our Badminton Champion Olympian PV Sindhu with Venkatta Datta Sai in Udaipur last evening and conveyed my wishes & blessings to the couple for their new life ahead. — Gajendra Singh Shekhawat (@gssjodhpur)

The wedding was a joyous affair, marking a new chapter in Sindhu's life as she balances her athletic career with personal commitments.

item.title: Step inside Manu Bhaker's lavish and designer home in Haryana worth Rs... - India.com
item.description:
An Inside Look at Manu Bhaker's Luxurious Home in Haryana

Published on: Unknown Source: India.com

This article provides a stunning visual tour of double Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker's designer home in Haryana. The luxurious interiors and thoughtful designs reflect the personality and success of the athlete.

  • The home is filled with lavish decor and designer elements, showcasing Manu's achievements and style.
  • It features a spacious living room with Sabyasachi wallpaper, a yoga room for tranquility, and a leisure room for relaxation.
  • Manu's bedroom includes a cozy reading nook and a hand-painted doodle wall that adds a personal touch.
  • The trophy wall highlights her numerous accolades, giving a glimpse of her remarkable achievements in shooting.
“The interior decor of Paris Olympics 2024 medallist will leave you stunned.”

In conclusion, Manu Bhaker's home is not just a living space; it's a reflection of her journey and personality, combining luxury with comfort and showcasing her impressive accomplishments.
